name: Parts

aliases.name: Accessors
aliases.comment:
For components where consumers do care about the model of the 
component, use the `accessors` function below to generate suitable, 
well, accessors.
aliases.type: { get : Parts.Get model c , set : Parts.Set model c , map : (model -> model) -> c -> c , reset : c -> c }

aliases.name: Get
aliases.comment: Type of "getter": fetch component model `m` from c model `c`.

aliases.name: Index
aliases.comment:
Type of indices. An index is a list of `Int` rather than just an `Int` to 
support nested dynamically constructed elements: Use indices `[0]`, `[1]`, ...
for statically known top-level components, then use `[0,0]`, `[0,1]`, ...
for a dynamically generated list of components.

aliases.name: Set
aliases.comment: Type of "setter": update component model `m` in c `c`.

types.name: Msg
types.comment:
Similar to how embeddings enable collecting models of different type
in a single model c, we collect messages in a single "master
message" type. Messages exist exclusively to be dispatched by a corresponding
`update` function; we can avoid distinguishing between different types of 
messages by dispatching not the `Msg` itself, but a partially applied update
function `update msg`. 

It's instructive to compare `Msg` to the type of `update` partially applied to 
an actual carried message `m`:

    update : m -> c -> (c, Cmd m)
    (update m) : c -> (c, Cmd m)

values.name: accessors
values.type: Parts.Get (Parts.Indexed model) c -> Parts.Set (Parts.Indexed model) c -> model -> Parts.Index -> Parts.Accessors model c

values.name: create
values.comment:
From `update` and `view` functions, produce a `view` function which (a) 
fetches its model from a `c` model, and (b) dispatches generic `Msg`
messages. 

Its instructive to compare the types of the input `view` and `update` for a 
typical case. Notice that `create` transforms `model` -> `c` and
`Html m` -> `Html (Msg c)`. 

  {- Input -}
  view : (m -> obs) -> model -> List (Attributes m) -> List (Html m) -> Html m
  update : m -> model -> (model, Cmd m)

  {- Output -}
  type alias m' = Msg c
  view : c -> List (Attributes m') -> List (Html m') -> Html m'

Note that the input `view` function is assumed to take a function lifting its
messages.
values.type: ((m -> obs) -> Parts.View model a) -> Parts.Update model m -> Parts.Get (Parts.Indexed model) c -> Parts.Set (Parts.Indexed model) c -> model -> (Parts.Msg c -> obs) -> Parts.Index -> Parts.View c a

values.name: create1
values.comment:
Like `create`, but for components that are assumed to have only one
instance.
values.type: ((msg -> obs) -> Parts.View model a) -> Parts.Update model msg -> Parts.Get model c -> Parts.Set model c -> (Parts.Msg c -> obs) -> Parts.View c a

values.name: embedUpdate
values.comment: Lift an `update` from operating on `model` to a c model `c`.
values.type: Parts.Get model c -> Parts.Set model c -> Parts.Update model msg -> Parts.Update c msg

values.name: embedView
values.comment:
Lift a `view` to one which knows how to retrieve its `model` from 
a c model `c`.
values.type: Parts.Get model c -> Parts.View model a -> Parts.View c a

values.name: indexed
values.comment: Fix a getter and setter for an `Indexed model` to a particular `Index`.
values.type: Parts.Get (Parts.Indexed model) c -> Parts.Set (Parts.Indexed model) c -> model -> Parts.Index -> ( Parts.Get model c, Parts.Set model c )

values.name: update
values.type: (Parts.Msg c -> m) -> Parts.Msg c -> c -> ( c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd m )
